channel.title: How do you know what port your source is running on?
channel.description:
How do you know what port your source is running on? To start: I know that the default port is "43594" --> But when I port forward with that port, nothing happens... Which is not normal.
Can anybody help me plz? (:
Greetz, HaPpyShit

item.title: How do you know what port your source is running on?
item.dc:creator: @HaPpyShits HaPpyShits
item.description:
@HaPpyShits wrote:

00mike:

no its the user of the comp that cant port forward.

Serious dude, I know what I’m doing…
And my provider is the worst one to find something back…
A lot of people had the same problem as me in other forum’s…
But they still didn’t found a solution…

Read full topic
item.source: How do you know what port your source is running on?

item.title: How do you know what port your source is running on?
item.dc:creator: @HaPpyShits HaPpyShits
item.description:
@HaPpyShits wrote:

Mr. Despair:

Lol, it means you didn’t port forward correctly.

You’re right ^^
But… With my provider is crappy to port forward… :S
It just doesn’t work, not even one tutorial helps…

Read full topic

If you insist on checking what port the server accepts connections on then check the server class.

item.source: How do you know what port your source is running on?

item.title: How do you know what port your source is running on?
item.dc:creator: @HaPpyShits HaPpyShits
item.description:
@HaPpyShits wrote:

[quote=“demonlover14, post:4, topic:338690”][quote author=HaPpyShits link=topic=435078.msg3195186#msg3195186 date=1272725590]

Find out?
When you portforward you chose the port you want.

Lol, I know, but when I run my source I don’t know what port he is running on :S
[/quote]
I don’t understand?. . .your the one port forwarding…[/quote]

I port forwarded to this port: 43594 but it doesn’t work publicly
So I think my source/client runs on another port, but how do I know which one?

Read full topic
item.source: How do you know what port your source is running on?

[/quote]
